title: League changes every 2 weeks
body:
The meta sometimes faster.

And when it does. 
Top tier champions change.
Broken items change.
Shitty champions change.
Class and role values change.
Pro picks and bans change.

And yes, people's complaints change.

So can we stop these..
"my champ fien two months ago y u problm now?"
..posts?

EVERY champion is capable of being OP or shit. The champion is no longer fine because they are no longer fine. End of the story.

On the same note, just because a champion was OP last week doesn't mean they cannot be weak this week.

replies.body:
but the one constant

IS PEOPLE COMPLAIN !!!

i heard you guys like to argue about anything

who would win 5 rugged garens or 5 rogue admiral garens?
Rugged
It is best Garen. Quite fetching.
How dare you! Rugged garen is subpar at best but rogue admiral,Oh how dreamy...

> [{quoted}](name=lilycu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bl6Xq2oQ,comment-id=000000000001000000000002,timestamp=2017-05-28T03:47:34.499+0000)
>
> How dare you! Rugged garen is subpar at best but rogue admiral,Oh how dreamy...

rugged is marriage material, but damn rogue has a really nice body
Commando

{{champion:117}} what are you talking about xd? it's only THA META!!! i've been only permabanned since 5 months now, just wait for tha meta to shift

kappapride
i could never understand what was riot thinking when thy designed LULU she has literally double spells on her W E,make her either a Support or Mage you cant keep both utility and dmg.

> [{quoted}](name=korg023,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bl6Xq2oQ,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2017-05-28T11:14:33.034+0000)
>
> i could never understand what was **xypherous **thinking 

fixed
people shall remember his garbage work

Tell that to  {{champion:268}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:429}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3091}} {{champion:6}}, especially {{item:3056}}, and possibly a few others things which rarely see any kind of increase in play/pick rate. And if they do get a buff from somewhere, they usually are nerfed in the next patch, or the change is reverted/nerfed and once again they fall back on to....

 **RIOT's Shit Tier List of Forsaken Champions and Items 
- _"Bet you forgot that they were still in the game!"_**
Urgot is literally getting a rework very soon.
Kalista is actually pretty good right now.
Guess she needs some nerfs then.
I remember when Syndra was seen as the one of the worst mages during season 3&4.
Funny part was: she was (still) busted AF back then.
I remember that too... I don't think she was the WORST but she took 'skill' to play back than. That's why I started playing her.

But one thing never changes...

Nobody plays Mordekaiser.

You should be happy. If Mordekaiser was popular, he would be hated, not praised. He's helpless against certain champions who can avoid his attacks, but he completely dominates those who cannot. 

You would have posts on both sides. One probably complaining that he's trash tier and that OP doesn't want to see one on his team. Another saying he's stupidly broken and needs nerfs. Be glad he's not meta.
good thing too because i hate facing him.

I mean same with Shyvana. Unfortunately they are either blatantly broken or underused. But I don't mind playing an obscure champion. Makes those moments when you blow them up all the more fun.

https://vid.me/mtg5

https://vid.me/Z1IZ

You're saying that Shyvana is obscure?

*cries*

1.13% pick rate 0.07% ban rate and very few popular memes unlike Morde. She has too high of a learning curve in terms of strategy and itemization for newbies but is too mechanically simply for outplay skill junkies. But I absolutely love her; 735 games.

I don't know whether I should come back to her. Is she viable at this point (considering that Blade of the Ruined King got buffs in past months and I was away from the game for a while)? Sejuani seems to have better ganks now.

How are you doing, by the way?
sejuani is literal freelo so you should use her until riot dumpsters her

Sej is great right now. And I am good though just finishing up two straight weeks of work without break. 

Shyvana is viable and usable but not strong. You have to be good at her to make her work. My w/r on her is 63% ranked 67% normals.

"The meta changes a lot"... then you see Lee Sin has been GodTier in the jungler for five seasons. 

The problem is that the meta doesn't change enough; if a champ is broken in January, there are great chances of that champ been broken during the whole season.
Meanwhile Yorick, Urgot, Nunu, Heimer etc. are trash tier since season 2 or even before.
Doesn't nunu have the like second highest winrate?
Having a high winrate doesnt mean he is strong, it just shows that the ones who play him do well in the situations where they pick him.
After the buffs, Nunu is actually one of the stronger junglers. He's like a dumbed-down, more reliable Ivern. Very few can control objectives as well he can.
Except he doesnt have any hard cc nor spammable shields, which are Ivern main strengths.

That is true. But they both fit into the category of supportive junglers. Which means they don't carry by themselves, but instead boost their team's performance. In this case, Nunu has strong soft cc, in the form of consistent slows. His blood boil and ability to execute monsters provide buffs to his team.

He already slowed before the buffs. They just gave him a little bit of extra damage thanks to the passive and made him tankier IIRC.

I mean, maybe he can be a decent niche pick but putting him in the bs levels of Ivern sounds exagerate.

Ivern is #1 Win rate

Nunu was #2

They're both support junglers

*Hint Hint*

Winrate alone doesnt mean shit.

_Hint Hint_

Not what I was referring to.
I was talking about Support Junglers being strong.

Anyways, winrate alone doesn't mean anything. True.

However winrate can be used to analyze if a champion is in a bad spot.

Any champion at the top of the list for winrate is generally speaking not BAD. It doesn't mean they're top notch, but someone on the top of the chain is not "trash"

Amumu, Nautilus and Sion arent played at all, Sejuani wasnt played before the reworks and LMaokai is an AP support now. Gragas and Zac were always busted tho.

> Any champion at the top of the list for winrate is generally speaking not BAD. It doesn't mean they're top notch, but someone on the top of the chain is not "trash"

Not necessarily true in my experience. There have also been cases of OP champions that were being played competitively having a shitty winrate under 50% in yoloQ, even below 48%.

> [{quoted}](name=Jamenawerl,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bl6Xq2oQ,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-28T12:18:26.619+0000)
>
> **Having a high winrate doesnt mean he is strong**

????????

Let's be real: I've seen that argument more than once on the boards. I've also seen a lot of people say that having a low winrate doesn't mean the champion is weak. 

Context is required.

Hmm..
My point was more that, while he might not be top-tier, it's hard to argue someone is "trash tier" when they have a well above average win-rate.

Might just be me, but I classify "Trash tier" as 100% dumpstered and usage is just putting your team at a disadvantage.
As well as Yorick getting a rework and becoming good, Urgot is soon to get a rework, and Heimer is still a good brainless champ.
Nunu had a period of being broken last year. Urgot is intentionally bad. Heimer they are trying to figure out what exactly to do with him since he is so oppressive otherwise. Yorick is fine.

I know, but Leesin is already oppresive and Rito doesnt keep him intentionally weak... Quite the opposite, in fact.

Favoritisms.

I don't disagree. But there are different kinds of oppressive. Lee has counterplay and can easily fuck up. Someone like Garen when buffed is so Binary he can steamroll you with stats. Lee *does* in my opinion need work to make him fair. But he is not comparable to binary champions in balance reasoning.

Leesin has less counterplay than Urgot or Heimer imho.

Also, they already gutted other difficult champions like Azir or Kalista, so add double standards to the list.

Azir and Kalista had no counterplay worth noting. Urgot and Heimer only do because their numbers were shit on. Even my friend Tyrek, a former Azir main, realizes how BS Azir was. He was an ultimately safe lane bully, hyper carry, peeling, high CC, mobile utility mage who had no safe method of defeating him. Lee has issues but not even close to comparable.

Ahh Azir~
I wish his soldier Autoattack damage wasn't nerfed
It was so good and destroyed people who didn't even SEE him. 

I'm just nothing down what I miss about Azir. Just an old Azir main
^^

> He was an ultimately safe lane bully, hyper carry, peeling, high CC, mobile utility mage who had no safe method of defeating him.

Change "hyper carry" for "initiator" and you have succesfully described Leesin.


Urgot relies on landing his E, which can be dodged. Also, his R is interruptible and if cleansed with QSS you can position him wherever you like.
Heimer needs time to position his turrets and is useless if you fight outside of their range or destroy them before you engage. Both his missiles and his grenade are dodgeable.

Leesin counterplay is limited to dodging his Q, which sometimes he can just land from point blank range.
